layer.name: Sacrifice
layer.definition: Pour out for others with no expectation of return.

questions.text: I use my credibility and reputation to advocate for people who have none — spending my moral capital for their benefit.
questions.principle: Reputation can be spent for others

questions.text: I defend unpopular positions or unpopular people when I believe they're right, even at cost to my standing.
I speak uncomfortable truth to people who need to hear it, even when it would be easier to stay silent and popular.
I have taken moral stands that cost me relationships, opportunities, or comfort — and I don't regret them.
I advocate for the voiceless and marginalized even when there's nothing in it for me — no recognition, no reciprocity.
questions.principle: Advocacy for the powerless is pure sacrifice
